abstract: Late Sen Edward M Kennedy, in oral history interview posted online, recalls how he obtained subcommittee assignments as a freshman on Capitol Hill in 1963; recounts complying with demand from Sen James O Eastland, chairman of Senate Judiciary Committee, that he share in round of drinking early in morning in order to get assignments he wanted.
lead_paragraph: In oral history interviews released Wednesday, Senator Edward M. Kennedy talked about how he got subcommittee assignments early in 1963.

headline.main: Edward Kennedy’s Scotch-Infused Senate Job Interview
headline.print_headline: A Freshman Senator’s Scotch-Infused Job Interview

snippet: In oral history interviews released Wednesday, Senator Edward M. Kennedy talked about how he got subcommittee assignments early in 1963.
